borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing dwellinghouse.

<p><span class="ui-provider fy b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak" dir="ltr">Notwithstanding the time limits given to implement planning permission as prescribed by Sections 91 and 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended), this permission in so far as it relates to the development (being granted under section 73A of the Act in respect of development already carried out) shall have effect from the date of this decision notice.</span><br></p>

<p>a) The glass in the windows and door on the East elevation of the outbuilding hereby approved shall be replaced with glass that is obscure glass to a level equivalent to Pilkington Level 3 or above and be non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened is more than 1.7 metres above the finished floor level of the room in which the window is installed.</p><p>b) Both requirements described under part a) of this condition shall be completely installed in accordance with these requirements before one (1) month from the date of this permission and details of compliance must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>c) The replacement windows as approved shall thereafter be maintained and retained in accordance with these details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:</p><ul><li>Site Location Plan - Received: 13/06/2023<br></li><li>LIVARCH/94WR/101 - Existing Plans and Elevations [Issue A] - 09/06/2023</li><li>LIVARCH/94WR/103 - Existing Site Plan [Issue B] - 13/06/2023</li></ul><p>No other drawings or documents apply.</p>
description: Retrospective application for the construction of an outbuilding
